snippet: Alberto Vilar, a major benefactor of the Metropolitan Opera who was found guilty of financial crimes in 2008, won an extension of his curfew for a performance of “Eugene Onegin.”
abstract: Alberto Vilar, longtime major donor to Metropolitan Opera before his conviction for financial crimes, will be allowed to attend sold-out performance of Tchaikovsky opera Eugene Onegin after a federal judge agrees to extend his 11 pm curfew.
lead_paragraph: Alberto Vilar, a major benefactor of the Metropolitan Opera who was found guilty of financial crimes in 2008, won an extension of his curfew for a performance of “Eugene Onegin.”

headline.main: For a Night, a Convicted Donor Can Stay Late at the Opera
headline.print_headline: For a Night, a Convicted Donor Can Stay Late at the Opera
